TypeSignature.Value: public class EntityMappingConfiguration<TEntityType> where TEntityType : class
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EntityMappingConfiguration`1<class TEntityType> extends System.Object

Docs.typeparam: The entity type to be mapped.
Docs.summary: Configures the table and column mapping for an entity type or a sub-set of properties from an entity type. This configuration functionality is available via the Code First Fluent API, see .

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.EntityMappingConfiguration<TEntityType> HasTableAnnotation (string name, object value);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.EntityMappingConfiguration`1<!TEntityType> HasTableAnnotation(string name, object value) cil managed
Public Function HasTableAnnotation (name As String, value As Object) As EntityMappingConfiguration(Of TEntityType)
member this.HasTableAnnotation : string * obj -> System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.EntityMappingConfiguration<'EntityType (requires 'EntityType : null)>

Docs.param: The annotation name, which must be a valid C#/EDM identifier.
The annotation value, which may be a string or some other type that can be serialized with an
Docs.summary: Sets an annotation in the model for the table to which this entity is mapped. The annotation value can later be used when processing the table such as when creating migrations.
Docs.returns: The same configuration instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: It will likely be necessary to register a if the type of the annotation value is anything other than a string. Passing a null value clears any annotation with the given name on the column that had been previously set.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.EntityMappingConfiguration<TEntityType> MapInheritedProperties ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.EntityMappingConfiguration`1<!TEntityType> MapInheritedProperties() cil managed
Public Function MapInheritedProperties () As EntityMappingConfiguration(Of TEntityType)
member this.MapInheritedProperties : unit -> System.Data.Entity.ModelConfiguration.Configuration.EntityMappingConfiguration<'EntityType (requires 'EntityType : null)>

Docs.summary: Re-maps all properties inherited from base types. When configuring a derived type to be mapped to a separate table this will cause all properties to be included in the table rather than just the non-inherited properties. This is known as Table per Concrete Type (TPC) mapping.
Docs.returns: The same configuration instance so that multiple calls can be chained.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Properties<TObject> (System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<TEntityType,TObject>> propertiesExpression);
.method public hidebysig instance void Properties<TObject>(class System.Linq.Expressions.Expression`1<class System.Func`2<!TEntityType, !!TObject>> propertiesExpression) cil managed
Public Sub Properties(Of TObject) (propertiesExpression As Expression(Of Func(Of TEntityType, TObject)))
member this.Properties : System.Linq.Expressions.Expression<Func<'EntityType, 'Object>> -> unit

Docs.typeparam: An anonymous type including the properties to be mapped.
Docs.param: A lambda expression to an anonymous type that contains the properties to be mapped. C#: t => new { t.Id, t.Property1, t.Property2 } VB.Net: Function(t) New With { p.Id, t.Property1, t.Property2 }
Docs.summary: Configures the properties that will be included in this mapping fragment. If this method is not called then all properties that have not yet been included in a mapping fragment will be configured.
